tweets.text: Now I agree with you 100% @EmmaHowardBoyd! Water companies and farmers are ready for leadership which is strong and clear. Current regulation is underfunded and doesn't work. We want the @EnvAgency to be on our side, as it used to be. @DefraGovUK @Ofwat https://t.co/T6PuIm8mHr

urls.title: Whinlatter Forest dam project to combat floods
urls.description: Made from logs, the dams in Whinlatter Forest are set to reduce peak river levels downstream.

tweets.text: @V_BradK Hmm... I just tried to report it to the @EnvAgency who wouldn't take a report because it's too small/doesn't pose a flood risk, and said to report it to @ManCityCouncil instead. urls.description: Short seminar on Community Flood Resilience & Community Emergency Planning.

tweets.text: Together with @DevComsTogether and the @EnvAgencySW we are hosting a short seminar on Community Emergency Planning on Thursday 4 March at 6pm by Zoom. For more info and to book your place: https://t.co/4AJx6hF36h #NDevon https://t.co/IYF0QegRyz

"The Green Industrial Revolution needs Green Industrial #Regulation" @EmmaHowardBoyd Chair of @EnvAgency closes the keynote at our launch event for #FosteringProsperity @burohappold by restating why effective regulation is integral to both prosperity and environmental action.

Did anyone watch? it was an embarrassment to see how little we are doing in this country @EnvAgency to tackle this. Thank you @BBCPanorama for your work on this. There is a huge way to go to clear the litter and fly tipping pandemic in the U.K. https://t.co/W9JfJBvrcW

tweets.text: @socrates2sox @RewildingB @EnvAgency @ForestryEngland @GeorgeMonbiot ‚ÄúAh come on now Ted‚Äù

@Julesbirdie @EnvAgency I watched this and was so angry. Every time I go for a walk I see dumped mattresses etc. Surely it must cost more to clear this dumped waste than if it was free to take to the local recycling centre.

Using incentives to promote a culture of going beyond environmental compliance is something Govt should look at closely. But @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd rightly points out, fines need to be high enough for regulations to be effective in driving change #FosteringProsperity

While fresh water makes up less than one percent of Earth‚Äôs flowing water, it is home to 10 percent of all known species, including a third of all vertebrates.

Freshwater ecosystems have become the most degraded in the world. Can we save them?https://t.co/29NyLGhBmz via @NatGeo
